page.title: 09RELIGION
page.content: The Church of St.James the Deacon was completed in 1971. Although it is a modern Church there are many features which are very interesting. It is well worth a visit to see the many features incorporated into the building. The foundation stone is a medieval coffin lid dated between 1400-1500 AD. It came from St.Maurices Church in York and was laid as the foundation stone by Rt.Rev.Dr.Donald Cogan. The high altar is made from blue polished stone from Honiton in Devon which came from the Church of the College of St John, now defunct.The crucifix and the everlasting light came from St.Sampsons Church in York as did the pews and the twelve stations of the cross situated round the walls.
